message: Ahoy!
Ahoy!
Ahoy!
Ahoy!
The door to the cave is securely locked.
The mirror blurres. It obviously rejects you.
Baaah.
Baaah.

replies.text: You look strong enough to carry me. I hang down beneath you, and you pull me outwards.

message: The sheep carries you willingly.
Serve yourself, take all you like!

replies.text: [Sip a tiny glass of ruby wine]

message: I love your presence here! You may stay as long as you wish.

replies.text: Great! It is a wonderful place here!

message: Hello, child. Sit down, you may keep me company.

replies.text: We have a problem, sir. There's a rocky reef that the captain doesn't want to sail past. He's afraid of some singing creatures.
I have found $reg1 new parts for your map.

message: Oh, really? We have sirens here in the lake? Fascinating!
Of course! Everyone with a bit of education knows about them.
However, no one has yet returned alive to report what they sing.

replies.text: Then the trip is already over.

message: No, of course not. Just put something into your ears. Wax should work. Do you have beeswax with you?
You can get the best wax directly from a beekeeper. I know one: Leofric, I would trust him.
With practiced movements, Thyrope made several pairs of earplugs.
Here, take these earplugs. The wax was perfect for them, they'll work well.

replies.text: Thank you. I'm going to go and try them out right away.

message: I am Thyrope Splathershed, the famous scientist and cartologist.

replies.text: Splathershed? Haven't I heard that name before?

message: You probably know my brother, who wrote the famous treatise on the history of Dhajavar.

replies.text: Maybe. What are you doing here?
Cartologist? Then you must travel a lot. Have you seen my brother Andor?

message: Probably not. I mainly focus on the environment so I can create the most accurate maps possible.
There's less and less terra incognita... sorry, children don't understand these technical terms - I mean unknown parts of the world. My work is getting more and more difficult.
Here in Remgard, I've struck gold. The great lake here is well known in the coastal regions - but what's in the lake itself?
That's what I want to find out, and then I'll become famous with my map of the great lake.

replies.text: So you want to charter a ship and explore the lake? Sounds exciting.

message: What? No, absolutely not!
I'm not allowed to go myself. It would be an immeasurable loss to humanity if something were to happen to me.
But I'm looking for someone to make the trip and tell me about it.
You look like you don't have anything better to do right now anyway. Will you make the trip for me?

replies.text: [muttering] Nothing to do? If you only knew...

message: The ship is ready to depart from the dock, and the passage has already been paid for.
So then, Captain Burry will take you on board!
Come closer, $playername, and learn the truth of every road you have walked and every lie told about it.
We know the names you forgot, the faces you left behind, and the fate waiting at your door.
Stay, and we will sing you the ending of your story.
No man has sailed past us unchanged, for knowledge always takes its price.
Listen, and you will understand why your brother still feels farther away with every mile.
Untie yourself, clever one - wisdom should never be heard from a distance.
What you seek is not safety, but certainty, and we can give you that.
You have outwitted monsters and men, but you have never dared to face the truth we sing.
Hear us, and you will finally know which of your victories were earned, and which were merely spared.
We sing not to trap you, Odysseus, but to show you what you have been running from.
One day, the knots won't be tied tightly enough. Or the blocked ears won't be closed tightly enough.
We are hungry but patient.
End of journey. This is as far as we can go.

replies.text: Hey, there is still so much to expore.

message: See the rocky island over there? This is where the sirens live.
Dreadful creatures. They have lured many a brave crew to the rocks. The ships were wrecked there, and the crew was never seen again.

replies.text: Hmm, then just ignore it and we'll drive by really quickly.

message: Absolutely not. I will not sacrifice my ship and crew to the childish wish of a kid.

replies.text: Let me think: If you didn't hear the sirens, everything would be OK, right?

message: Of course. But we can't cover our ears and steer a ship at the same time.

replies.text: Look, I have earplugs here, take them and you can drive through here as often as you like without any problems.

message: Sounds like a plan. And you? How do you plan to stop yourself from simply jumping overboard?

replies.text: I'll take ear plugs too, of course.
Just tie me to the mast. And whatever you do, don't untie me, no matter how much I beg.

message: That's what we'll do. We'll be the first to cross the Sirens' Passage alive.
That's what we'll do. We'll be the first to cross the Sirens' Passage alive.

replies.text: And I am very curious to know what the sirens are shouting that lured so many to their doom.

message: You have to tell me later.
Be my guest! Stay as long as you wish.
You don't want to leave this paradise island.

replies.text: I don't want to leave this paradise island.

message: Hello kid. Finally, a sober tavern patron!

replies.text: Yes, the noise in here is almost unbearable.

message: That's why I have produced these ear plugs from beeswax. I could sell you some of them.

replies.text: With pleasure. Show me what you have for sale.

message: Ah. Good. Nice. Home.
[sniffs] Hm. The cave smells... strange today.
Oh, a guest! How unusual.
Don't be alarmed. I'm not alarmed by myself either.
[looking in the mirror] I just look dangerous.
[to the sheep] Quiet now. The visitor is looking.
You're in luck, little one. It's not a holiday today.
[grins proudly] But it will be soon.
The door is locked. You can't leave now. Don't be angry. Rules are rules.

This door has no key. Keys always get lost... 
It only opens when I look in this mirror. Clever, clever - just like me.

replies.text: So I can't just kill you to get out again.

message: What? How you dare? Me the mightiest of all cyclopes! Me Polyphem!
[beats his chest] My relatives will be coming for the next feast.
My hungry brothers.
[leans toward the player] And I'll bring the main course.
[straightens up, smugly] Fresh. Surprising. With sides.
You can stay until then. The sheep are nice. They don't talk much.
You should take a leaf out of their book.
[turns to the mirror, straightens up] Me too, by the way. Nice, I mean. Very nice, in fact.
They say I have an eye for guests.
Who are you, anyway?
Nobody, huh? But that's not important. I just need to know what to call the dish.
Without another word, Polyphem falls onto his bed and immediately begins to snore loudly.
Hmmm? [Polyphem opens his eye for a brief moment.]
Hmmm? [Polyphem opens his eye for a brief moment, but long enough for you.]

replies.text: You pour the harsh soapy water directly into Polyphem's eye.

message: AAAAH - MY EYE!
MY GOOD EYE!
[staggers backward, flailing blindly] That burns!
That's cheating!
That's... foamy!
[angry] YOU! Little one! WHERE ARE YOU?!
Calm down. Stay calm.
I'll see you again in a minute.
I CAN'T SEE ANYTHING ANYMORE!
[yells outside] BROTHERS! HELP!
[bangs against the cave wall] HELP! I'VE BEEN BLINDED!
[voices from outside, muffled, bored] What's wrong, Polyphem?
NOBODY! NOBODY BLINDED ME!
A stunned pause outside.
... What?
If nobody blinded you, why are you screaming?
BECAUSE IT HURTS!
[desperately] NOBODY WAS DOING IT!
HE'S STANDING HERE! OR WAS STANDING! NOT ANYMORE!
Then cool your eye.
And stop drinking.
Laughter outside, footsteps receding.
COME BACK!
HE'S DANGEROUS!
[quieter, offended] Very dangerous indeed. But nothing against me, Polyphem!
Coward.
Invisible coward.
[sniffs] I can still smell you.
Never mind. You're not getting out of here.
I'll let the sheep out, then I'll find you more easily.
Nobody! Was that you? Just you wait, I'll get you.
[to yourself] It works! He doesn't perceive me!
Don't go yet, you haven't thoroughly explored the cave.
A bucket of water? Surely something can be done with that...
On a whim, you dissolve the soap in the water. That must be extremely corrosive if someone gets it in their eye.
